meanings.definition: Having a color between black and white
meanings.sent1: The sky looked greyer as the storm approached.
meanings.sent2: Her cat's fur is getting greyer with age.
meanings.sent3: The greyer clouds seemed to be playing hide and seek with the sun.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph was becoming greyer with each passing year.
meanings.sent5: The greyer paint on the walls gave the room a somber feel.

meanings.sent2: Her sweater is greyer than mine.
meanings.sent3: The greyer sky made the colorful balloons stand out even more.
meanings.sent4: His hair was greyer than a winter sky.
meanings.sent5: The greyer clouds seemed to be carrying the weight of the world.

meanings.sent1: The old building's walls were getting greyer over time.
meanings.sent2: The sky was getting greyer as the day progressed.
meanings.sent3: The greyer hair on the dog made him look wiser.
meanings.sent4: The greyer shadows of evening crept across the lawn.
meanings.sent5: The greyer rocks near the shore blended seamlessly with the mist.
